response:
Unilateral optic neuritis plus partial thoracic myelitis in a middle-aged woman with subacute evolution and no systemic sepsis markers most strongly suggests immune-mediated CNS demyelination, particularly multiple sclerosis, with NMOSD and MOGAD important alternatives; other inflammatory, compressive, metabolic, and infectious causes of myelopathy must also be excluded.

differential_diagnosis = ["Multiple sclerosis", "Neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder (AQP4-IgG positive)", "MOG-antibody-associated disease", "Idiopathic acute transverse myelitis", "Spinal cord compression from tumour or epidural abscess", "Systemic autoimmune disease\u2013associated myelitis (e.g. systemic lupus erythematosus, Sj\u00f6gren's syndrome, neurosarcoidosis)", "Vitamin B12 deficiency (subacute combined degeneration of the cord)", "Infectious myelitis (e.g. HIV, syphilis, Lyme disease)"]
